result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Rosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge In carceration Program. The defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program AFTER serving the first 18 months of this sentence.
Consecutive to: Any other time being served

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample if not previously submitted; pay surcharge. Pay all mandatory applicable surcharges, fees, assessments and costs. The Court finds the State in compliance with victim rights legislation. Court ordered restitution set at zero. The court ordered that all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Pay all sueprvision fees.
Court advised defendant of following restrictions: Firearm possession/Voting.

- Obtain Mental Health Assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
- Take any and all prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.
- Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete foll-up treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, no drugs or alcohol with random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
- Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation Agent.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with victim Ranjit S. or RM Petroleum located at 1801 W. Greenfield Ave.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment of full time school and partime employment.
- Participate in Cognitive Thinking program.
- Obtain GED or HSED.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L Rosa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (31 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 07-01-2014 received and filed.
Sentencing Memorandum submitted by defense, filed.

Defendant Anthony L Rosa in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Anthony L Rosa in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 21.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment with the exception as noted on the record.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Anthony L Rosa not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (13 pages) commencing APRIL 8, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Anthony L Rosa not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense awaiting additional discovery.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Rosa in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Anthony L Rosa in custody.  Megan Carmody for Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Lisa Purcelli-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RM Petroleum Gas Station or Ranjit S.

Defendant Anthony L Rosa in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Anthony L Rosa in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
